name: Bullrun
overview: Bullrun is an American reality television series based on the trans-American Bullrun road rally of the same name. The televised version has 12 teams compete in a 4,000-mile 18-day road rally to win the grand prize of US$200,000. Bullrun uses a modified 12-car rally format.

episodes.name: Let's Get It On
episodes.overview: Twelve teams, driving their own cars, embark on a grueling 4000 mile road rally with huge cash on the line. Teams compete in a challenge where they have to hit rows of exploding targets with their cars. The teams must decide if they take the route mapped out for them, or if they go their own way. If they choose to take their own route.

episodes.name: Let the Breakdowns Begin
episodes.overview: Team Lamborghini and Team Nissan 240SX face car troubles. The drivers must compete in a challenge in which they have to destroy targets that are placed behind a school bus.

episodes.name: Road Kill
episodes.overview: The remaining teams join forces to try and eliminate one of the most successful duos. The drivers have to compete in a challenge involving a high-speed driving slalom.

episodes.name: Hometown Advantage
episodes.overview: One team is given the advantage of knowing the area they are driving in, which gives them the leg up. The other remaining teams begin to feel the pressures mounting and start to bicker with one another and cause more stress. The remaining drivers muust compete in a head-to-head driving battle. The teams have to attempt to tear of moving targets that are placed on the side of a speeding truck.

episodes.name: Catch My Drift
episodes.overview: Four teams compete in a drift contest with a twist. They must use their cars to crash through a wall of glass sideways. Chuck Aguilar of Team BMW M3 is dealt an unexpected blow when his uncle dies and leaves him with the decision to go home or not.

episodes.name: Wrecks, Lies and Videotape
episodes.overview: This weeks race starts off in Wendover, Utah and heads to Salt Lake City, Utah. The challenge in this episode is to smash their cars through barriers in a timed, quarter-mile race.

episodes.name: Midnight Run
episodes.overview: This leg of the race starts off in Salt Lake City, Utah and leads through Moab to Monument Valley. The challenge this week is to dodge crates that are falling off a truck the cars are chasing.

episodes.name: Operation Poison Arrow
episodes.overview: One team devises a risky strategy to knock out their rivals as others tangle with local law enforcement. Drivers compete in a wild centrifugal slalom course using their cars to smash targets.

episodes.name: No Brakes, No Steering, No Problem
episodes.overview: Four of the remaining teams must compete in a challenge that requires them to make their way down blind turns in a high-speed spiral slalom. Three of the teams target to get the other remaining team eliminated.

episodes.name: Run for the Border
episodes.overview: In the first season finale, the three remaining teams battle for the $200,000 grand prize.

episodes.name: LA to Las Vegas
episodes.overview: Twelve teams and their cars set off on their journey, which starts in LA and heads to Las Vegas for the first leg. The two slowest cars to reach the checkpoint, along with a team chosen by the lead car, end into the School Bus Take Down challenge.

episodes.name: Las Vegas to Lake Powell
episodes.overview: As the journey continues on the next leg from Las Vegas to Lake Powell, Team Evo gets caught cheating and earns the new nickname of Team Evil. The competiting teams visit wedding chapels while in Vegas.

episodes.name: Lake Powell to Cortez
episodes.overview: As the journey continues on the next leg from Lake Powell to Cortez, Colorado, one teams learns a valuable lesson about taking shortcuts. The three teams chosen for the challenge are required to drive through a slalom course blindfolded.

episodes.name: Cortez to Santa Fe
episodes.overview: As the journey continues on the next leg from Cortez to Santa Fe, one team's luck doesn't seem to change once they get lost on their horrible leg to Santa Fe. The three teams chosen for the challenge are required break their co-pilots out of jail, while avoiding the cops.

episodes.name: Santa Fe to Roswell
episodes.overview: As the journey continues on the next leg from Santa Fe to Roswell, one team is in for a shock when a surprise twist changes their plans.

episodes.name: Roswell to Truth or Consequences
episodes.overview: Alliances build and the competition gets tough as teams battle for supremacy. In this challenge they take it off-road.

episodes.name: Truth or Consequences to Show Low
episodes.overview: Bad weather strikes the bullrunners on the seventh leg of the rally.

episodes.name: Show Low to the Flagstaff
episodes.overview: One team resorts to dirty tricks after losing its lead at a railroad crossing.

episodes.name: Flagstaff to Phoenix
episodes.overview: One team commits a critical error by going to the wrong racetrack; stopping for directions helps another team reach the checkpoint.

episodes.name: The Final Leg
episodes.overview: The three remaining teams battle it out on the final leg of the journey to see who will become the winner of Bullrun season 2.

episodes.name: Corona to Mojave Airplane Graveyard
episodes.overview: The twelve teams meet at West Coast Customs in Corona California, quickly size up their machines, then hit the road.

episodes.name: Night Leg
episodes.overview: The teams are surprised to find the second leg will be a night run to the Eagle Army Base in Firebaugh California.

episodes.name: Eagle Field to the Sacramento Rail Yard
episodes.overview: The Bullrunners start the third leg only to find that overnight someone has stolen all the maps.

episodes.name: Sacremento to Carson City
episodes.overview: One team convinces the local police to escort them out of town; three teams compete on a flaming dirt track in the Challenge.

episodes.name: Carson City to Fernley Raceway
episodes.overview: It’s the longest leg of the rally, through the hot Nevada desert.

episodes.name: Nevada to Oregon
episodes.overview: Thinking they have time to spare, one team stops at a drive-thru for some hamburgers; another team is eliminated.

episodes.name: Lakeview to Oakridge, Oregon
episodes.overview: One team fakes running out of fuel to see who will slow down; a team stopped by police gets good directions from the officer.

episodes.name: Oregon to California
episodes.overview: A forest fire forces the teams to take a detour; one team plays mind games on another during down time.

episodes.name: Sonoma Dunes to Shasta
episodes.overview: The final four teams are slowed by road work; a navigator falls asleep on duty, leading to friction with a teammate.
